meanings.definition: To set a price in advance.
meanings.sent1: I will preprice the items before the sale starts.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to preprice products before they are displayed.
meanings.sent3: The shop owner prepriced the goods, but forgot to remove the tags!
meanings.sent4: She prepriced her services to attract more customers.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preprice your items for the upcoming event to avoid any confusion.

meanings.sent1: The preprice for the concert tickets was reasonable.
meanings.sent2: Customers appreciate a clear preprice for products.
meanings.sent3: The preprice on the menu made choosing a dish easier.
meanings.sent4: The preprice of the car was higher than expected.
meanings.sent5: Knowing the preprice of the item helped me budget effectively.
